module.name: Graphics
module.short: Unit contains definitions for many fundamental classes and types used in graphic applications

element.name: TFontData
element.short: A record holding Data about the current Font

element.name: TFontData.Handle
element.short: The Operating System Handle for the current Font

element.name: TFontData.Height
element.short: The Height (in pixels) if the current Font

element.name: TFontData.Pitch
element.short: The Pitch (in points) of the currentFont

element.name: TFontData.Style
element.short: The Style of the Font
element.descr: Bold, Italic, Strikeout or Underlined

element.name: TFontData.CharSet
element.short: The Character Set of the current Font (expresed as an integer)

element.name: TFontData.Name
element.short: The Name (as a string) of the current Font

element.name: DefFontData
element.short: Data about the Default Font in the current context

element.name: TTextLayout
element.short: How the Text is to be laid out in the Text Rectangle
element.descr: At the Bottom, Centre or Top of the available window or box

element.name: TTextStyle
element.short: The Style of the Text to be drawn in a rectangle
element.descr:
Alignment : TextRect Only: horizontal alignment
Layout : TextRect Only: vertical alignment
SingleLine: boolean; If WordBreak is false then process #13, #10 as standard chars and perform no Line breaking.
Clipping : boolean; TextRect Only: Clip Text to passed Rectangle
ExpandTabs: boolean; currently ignored
ShowPrefix: boolean; TextRect Only: Process first single ampersand per line as an underscore and draw double ampersand as a single ampersand
Wordbreak : boolean; TextRect Only: If line of text is too long to fit between left and right boundaries, try to break into multiple lines between words
Opaque : boolean; TextRect: Fills background with current Brush
Opaque : TextOut : Fills background with current foreground color
SystemFont: Boolean; Use the system font instead of Canvas Font
RightToLeft: Boolean; For RightToLeft text reading (Text Direction)

element.name: TBrushStyle
element.short: Style of Brush to be used

element.name: TFont
element.short: The Font to be used for drawing Text
element.descr:
Most of the data about the font are dealt with by the protected procedures GetData and SetData which operate on TFontData
Individual properties such as Character Set, colour and size can be accessed in the public area

element.name: TFont.Create
element.short: Font constructor
element.descr: Opens a new instance of the class and sets defaults for character set, colour, size etc

element.name: TFont.Destroy
element.short: Font destructor

element.name: TFont.Assign
element.short: Assign - copies the LogFont or Source settings to itself
element.descr:
Method: TFont.Assign
Params: ALogFont: TLogFont or Source: another font
Returns: nothing
Copies the logfont or source settings to itself

element.name: TFont.CharSet
element.short: The Character Set to be used by the currentFont

element.name: TFont.Color
element.short: Colour of the current Font
element.descr: Default is the same as the text used for the rest of the Window

element.name: TFont.Name
element.short: Name of the Font

element.name: TFont.Pitch
element.short: Pitch type of the Font
element.descr:
Fixed or variable pitch, or Default
Reads or writes a flag to determine pitch type

element.name: TFont.Size
element.short: FontSize in pixels

element.name: TFont.Style
element.short: Style of the Font
element.descr:
Bold, Italic, Strike out, Underline
Property is a set, so may contain zero or more of the above (if set is empty, Normal font is displayed)

element.name: TPenData
element.short: The Data associated with the current Pen

element.name: TPenData.Handle
element.short: The Operating System Handle associated with the current Pen

element.name: TPenData.Color
element.short: The Colour of the curent Pen

element.name: TPenData.Width
element.short: The Width in pixels of the current Pen

element.name: TPenData.Style
element.short: The Style asociated with the current Pen
element.descr:
The Style asociated with the current Pen
Can take any of the values: psSolid, psDash, psDot, psDashDot, psDashDotDot, psinsideFrame, psPattern,psClear

element.name: TPen
element.short: The current Pen for drawing on the current Canvas

element.name: TPen.Create
element.short: Pen Constructor
element.descr: Most of its properties are inherited from the parent class

element.name: TPen.Destroy
element.short: Pen Destructor
element.descr: Most of its properties are inherited from the parent class

element.name: TPen.Assign
element.short: Copies the SourcePen to itself

element.name: TPen.Handle
element.short: the Operating System Handle for the current Pen
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the handle

element.name: TPen.Color
element.short: The Colour of the current Pen
element.descr: Reads or Writes a flag to determine the colour. Default is black

element.name: TPen.Mode
element.short: The Mode for the current Pen
element.descr:
Can take any of the values:
pmBlack, pmWhite, pmNop, pmNot, pmCopy, pmNotCopy,
pmMergePenNot, pmMaskPenNot, pmMergeNotPen, pmMaskNotPen, pmMerge,
pmNotMerge, pmMask, pmNotMask, pmXor, pmNotXor
Default is pmCopy

element.name: TPen.Style
element.short: The Style of the current Pen
element.descr:
Can be one of the following:
psSolid, psDash, psDot, psDashDot, psDashDotDot, psinsideFrame, psPattern,psClear
Default is psSolid

element.name: TPen.Width
element.short: The Width in pixels of the current Pen

element.name: TBrushData
element.short: The Data associated with the current Brush

element.name: TBrushData.Handle
element.short: The Operating System Handle associated with the current Brush

element.name: TBrushData.Color
element.short: The Colour to be used by the current Brush

element.name: TBrushData.Bitmap
element.short: The Bitmap on which the current Brush is working

element.name: TBrushData.Style
element.short: The Style to be used by the current Brush
element.descr: Enumerated type defined in TBrushStyle

element.name: TBrush
element.short: The Brush to be used to Paint on the current Canvas
element.descr: A Brush is typically used to fill an enclosed area on theCanvas with one particular colour or coloured pattern

element.name: TBrush.Assign
element.short: Assign - copies a SourceBrush to itself
element.descr:
Method: TBrush.Assign
Params: Source: Another brush
Returns: nothing
Copies the source brush to itself

element.name: TBrush.Assign.Source
element.short: Source - another Brush

element.name: TBrush.Create
element.short: Brush constructor
element.descr: Inherits most of its properties from ancestor Classes

element.name: TBrush.Destroy
element.short: Brush destructor
element.descr: Inherits properties to remove Brush and frees Handle

element.name: TBrush.Bitmap
element.short: The BitMap associated with the current Brush
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the current BitMap

element.name: TBrush.Handle
element.short: Operating System Handle for this Brush
element.descr: Reads or writes flag to determine system Handle

element.name: TBrush.Color
element.short: The Colour of the current Brush
element.descr: Reads or writes a flag to determine the Colour. Default is White

element.name: TBrush.Style
element.short: Style of the Brush
element.descr: Enumerated type - default Solid

element.name: TGraphic
element.short: Base class for dealing with Graphic images
element.descr:
The TGraphic class is an abstract base class for dealing with graphic images such as bitmaps, pixmaps, icons, and other image formats. It does not contain an actual area for displaying the image; this is provided by the descendant classes eg BitMap, Icon etc which have a Canvas element defined
LoadFromFile - Read the graphic from the file system. The old contents of the graphic are lost. If the file is not of the right format, an exception will be generated.
SaveToFile - Writes the graphic to disk in the file provided.
LoadFromStream - Like LoadFromFile except source is a stream (e.g. TBlobStream ).
SaveToStream - stream analogue of SaveToFile .
LoadFromClipboardFormat - Replaces the current image with the data provided. If the TGraphic does not support that format it will generate an exception.
SaveToClipboardFormats - Converts the image to a clipboard format. If the image does not support being translated into a clipboard format it will generate an exception.
Height - The native, unstretched, height of the graphic.
Palette - Color palette of image. Zero if graphic doesn't need/use palettes.
Transparent - Some parts of the image are not opaque, ie the background can be seen through.
Width - The native, unstretched, width of the graphic.
OnChange - Called whenever the graphic changes
PaletteModified - Indicates in OnChange whether color palette has changed. Stays true until whoever is responsible for realizing this new palette (ex: TImage) sets it to False.
OnProgress - Generic progress indicator event. Propagates out to TPicture and TImage OnProgress events.
As many of the methods and properties are virtual and/or abstract, it is the responsibility of the application programmer to supply suitable methods when implementing any descendant classes

element.name: TGraphic.Create
element.short: TGraphic constructor
element.descr: Virtual method, so recommend that a constructor be supplied to override this method in descendant classes

element.name: TGraphic.LoadFromFile
element.short: LoadFromFile - Read the graphic from the file system.
element.descr:
LoadFromFile - Read the graphic from the file system.
The old contents of the graphic are lost.
If the file is not of the right format, an exception will be generated.
element.errors: Incorrect file format generates an exception

element.name: TGraphic.LoadFromFile.Filename
element.short: The name of the file containing the graphic, held as a string

element.name: TGraphic.SaveToFile
element.short: SaveToFile - Writes the graphic to disk in the file provided.
element.descr: SaveToFile - Writes the graphic to disk in the file whose name is provided.

element.name: TGraphic.SaveToFile.Filename
element.short: The name of the file to which the graphic will be written

element.name: TGraphic.LoadFromStream
element.short: LoadFromStream -reads graphic data from a stream (e.g. TBlobStream )

element.name: TGraphic.LoadFromStream.Stream
element.short: Identity of the stream from which the graphic data are to be read

element.name: TGraphic.SaveToStream
element.short: SaveToStream - write graphic data to a stream
element.descr: SaveToStream - write graphic data to a stream

element.name: TGraphic.SaveToStream.Stream
element.short: Identity of the stream to which the graphic data are to be written

element.name: TGraphic.LoadFromClipboardFormat
element.short: LoadFromClipboardFormat - Replace the current image with the contents of the clipboard
element.descr: LoadFromClipboardFormat - Replaces the current image with the data provided from the clipboard.
element.errors: If the TGraphic does not support that format it will generate an exception.

element.name: TGraphic.SaveToClipboardFormat
element.short: SaveToClipboardFormats - Converts the image to a clipboard format
element.descr: SaveToClipboardFormats - Converts the image to a clipboard format
element.errors: If the image does not support being translated into a clipboard format it will generate an exception

element.name: TGraphic.SaveToClipboardFormat.FormatID
element.short: Identity of the clipboard format

element.name: TGraphic.Height
element.short: Height - The native, unstretched, height of the graphic.

element.name: TGraphic.Palette
element.short: Palette - Color palette of image
element.descr: Palette - Color palette of image. Zero if graphic doesn't need/use palettes

element.name: TGraphic.Transparent
element.short: Transparent - Some parts of the image are not opaque. ie the background can be seen through

element.name: TGraphic.Width
element.short: Width - The native, unstretched, width of the graphic.

element.name: TPicture
element.short: TPicture is a TGraphic container, used in place of a TGraphic if the graphic can be of any TGraphic class.
element.descr:
TPicture is a TGraphic container. It is used in place of a TGraphic if the graphic can be of any TGraphic class.
It is not a direct descendant of TGraphic , so you will not see TGraphic listed in the Inheritance chart, but it contains a property Graphic , of type TGraphic , so can contain all the properties of a TGraphic
Defines many private methods for getting and storing various sorts of images such as bitmaps, pixmaps, icons, PNGs etc
It does not itself contain a defined area for displaying the image, but this is supplied by the descendant classes such as BitMap, PixMap, PNG or Icon, which define a Canvas property.
LoadFromFile and SaveToFile are polymorphic. For example, if the TPicture is holding an Icon, you can LoadFromFile a bitmap file, where if the class is TIcon you could only read .ICO files.
LoadFromFile - Reads a picture from disk. The TGraphic class created is determined by the file extension of the file. If the file extension is not recognized an exception is generated.
SaveToFile - Writes the picture to disk.
LoadFromClipboardFormat - ToDo: Reads the picture from the handle provided in the given clipboard format. If the format is not supported, an exception is generated.
SaveToClipboardFormats - ToDo: Allocates a global handle and writes the picture in its native clipboard format (CF_BITMAP for bitmaps, CF_METAFILE for metafiles, etc.). Formats will contain the formats written. Returns the number of clipboard items written to the array pointed to by Formats and Datas or would be written if either Formats or Datas are nil.
SupportsClipboardFormat - Returns true if the given clipboard format is supported by LoadFromClipboardFormat
.
Assign - Copies the contents of the given TPicture. Used most often in the implementation of TPicture properties.
RegisterFileFormat - Register a new TGraphic class for use in LoadFromFile.
RegisterClipboardFormat - Registers a new TGraphic class for use in LoadFromClipboardFormat.
UnRegisterGraphicClass - Removes all references to the specified TGraphic class and all its descendants from the file format and clipboard format internal lists.
Height - The native, unstretched, height of the picture.
Width - The native, unstretched, width of the picture.
Graphic - The TGraphic object contained by the TPicture
Bitmap - Returns a bitmap. If the contents is not already a bitmap, the contents are thrown away and a blank bitmap is returned.
Pixmap - Returns a pixmap. If the contents is not already a pixmap, the contents are thrown away and a blank pixmap is returned.
PNG - Returns a png. If the contents is not already a png, the contents are thrown away and a blank png (TPortableNetworkGraphic) is returned.
PNM - Returns a pnm. If the contents is not already a pnm, the contents are thrown away and a blank pnm (TPortableAnyMapGraphic) is returned.

element.name: TPicture.Create
element.short: TPicture constructor

element.name: TPicture.Destroy
element.short: TPicture destructor
element.descr: Any destructor method defined here will override destructors defined in ancestor classes

element.name: TPicture.LoadFromFile
element.short: LoadFromFile - Reads a picture from disk
element.descr: LoadFromFile - Reads a picture from disk. The TGraphic class created is determined by the file extension of the file.
element.errors: If the file extension is not recognized an exception is generated

element.name: TPicture.LoadFromFile.Filename
element.short: The name of the file containing the picture, stored as a string

element.name: TPicture.SaveToFile
element.short: SaveToFile - Writes the picture to disk

element.name: TPicture.SaveToFile.Filename
element.short: The name of the file to save the picture, stored as a string

element.name: TPicture.LoadFromClipboardFormat
element.descr: LoadFromClipboardFormat - ToDo: Reads the picture from the handle provided in the given clipboard format.
element.errors: If the format is not supported, an exception is generated

element.name: TPicture.LoadFromClipboardFormat.FormatID
element.short: The identifier for the clipboard format

element.name: TPicture.SaveToClipboardFormat
element.short: SaveToClipboardFormats - Allocates a global handle and writes the picture in its native clipboard format
element.descr: SaveToClipboardFormats - ToDo: Allocates a global handle and writes the picture in its native clipboard format (CF_BITMAP for bitmaps, CF_METAFILE for metafiles, etc.). Formats will contain the formats written. Returns the number of clipboard items written to the array pointed to by Formats and Datas or would be written if either Formats or Datas are nil.

element.name: TPicture.SaveToClipboardFormat.FormatID
element.short: Identity of the clipboard format

element.name: TPicture.SupportsClipboardFormat
element.short: SupportsClipboardFormat - Returns true if the given clipboard format is supported by LoadFromClipboardFormat

element.name: TPicture.SupportsClipboardFormat.Result
element.short: Boolean - returns true if format supported

element.name: TPicture.SupportsClipboardFormat.FormatID
element.short: Identity of the clipboard format

element.name: TPicture.Assign
element.short: Assign - Copies the contents of the given TPicture
element.descr: Assign - Copies the contents of the given TPicture. Used most often in the implementation of TPicture properties.

element.name: TPicture.RegisterFileFormat
element.short: RegisterFileFormat - Register a new TGraphic class for use in LoadFromFile

element.name: TPicture.RegisterClipboardFormat
element.short: RegisterClipboardFormat - Registers a new TGraphic class for use in LoadFromClipboardFormat

element.name: TPicture.UnregisterGraphicClass
element.short: UnRegisterGraphicClass - Removes all references to the specified TGraphic
element.descr: UnRegisterGraphicClass - Removes all references to the specified TGraphic class and all its descendants from the file format and clipboard format internal lists

element.name: TPicture.Clear
element.short: Clear - removes the graphic

element.name: TPicture.Bitmap
element.short: Bitmap - Returns a bitmap
element.descr: Bitmap - Returns a bitmap. If the contents is not already a bitmap, the contents are thrown away and a blank bitmap is returned

element.name: TPicture.Pixmap
element.short: Pixmap - Returns a pixmap
element.descr: Pixmap - Returns a pixmap. If the contents is not already a pixmap, the contents are thrown away and a blank pixmap is returned

element.name: TPicture.PNG
element.short: PNG - Returns a png
element.descr: PNG - Returns a png. If the contents is not already a png, the contents are thrown away and a blank png (TPortableNetworkGraphic) is returned

element.name: TPicture.Icon
element.short: Icon contained within the picture

element.name: TPicture.Graphic
element.short: Graphic - The TGraphic object contained by the TPicture

element.name: TPicture.Height
element.short: Height - The native, unstretched, height of the picture

element.name: TPicture.Width

element.name: TCanvas
element.short: TCanvas - where most of the drawing is performed
element.descr: TCanvas is a class that defines a very large number of drawing methods including methods for pen and colour selection, producing shapes and filling them, setting or clearing individual pixels, and producing graphic text.

element.name: TCanvas.Create
element.short: Canvas constructor
element.descr: Canvas constructor: creates a new instance of the class TCanvas

element.name: TCanvas.Destroy
element.short: Canvas destructor
element.descr: Canvas destructor: removes this instance of TCanvas and makes its resources available

element.name: TCanvas.Arc
element.short: Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Arc
Params: ALeft, ATop, ARight, ABottom, sx, sy, ex, ey
Returns: Nothing
Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen. The values sx,sy, and ex,ey represent the starting and ending radial-points between which the Arc is drawn.

element.name: TCanvas.Arc
element.short: Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Arc
Params: ALeft, ATop, ARight, ABottom, angle1, angle2
Returns: Nothing
Use Arc to draw an elliptically curved line with the current Pen.
The angles angle1 and angle2 are 1/16th of a degree.
For example, a full circle equals 5760 (16*360).
Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction.
Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position.

element.name: TCanvas.Chord
element.short: Chord draws a filled Chord-shape on the canvas
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Chord
Params: x1, y1, x2, y2, StartAngle16Deg, EndAngle16Deg
Returns: Nothing
Use Chord
to draw a filled Chord-shape on the canvas. The angles angle1
and angle2
are 1/16th of a degree. For example, a full circle equals 5760(16*360).
Positive values of Angle
and AngleLength
mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction.
Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position.

element.name: TCanvas.Ellipse
element.short: Ellipse draws a filled circle or ellipse on the canvas
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Ellipse
Params: X1, Y1, X2, Y2
Returns: Nothing
Use Ellipse to draw a filled circle or ellipse on the canvas.

element.name: TCanvas.Line
element.short: Draws a Line from X1, Y1 to X2, Y2

element.name: TCanvas.LineTo
element.short: LineTo draws a line from the current pen position to the new position: X1, Y1

element.name: TCanvas.MoveTo
element.short: Moves cursor to new position X1, Y1 without drawing anything

element.name: TCanvas.RadialPie
element.short: RadialPie uses Pie to draw a filled pie-shaped wedge on the canvas
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.RadialPie
Params: x1, y1, x2, y2, StartAngle16Deg, EndAngle16Deg: Integer
Returns: Nothing
Uses Pie
to draw a filled pie-shaped wedge on the canvas.
The angles StartAngle16Deg
and EndAngle16Deg
are 1/16th of a degree.
For example, a full circle equals 5760 (16*360).
Positive values of Angle and AngleLength mean counter-clockwise while negative values mean clockwise direction.
Zero degrees is at the 3 o'clock position

element.name: TCanvas.Pie
element.short: Pie draws a filled Pie-shaped wedge on the canvas
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Pie
Params: EllipseX1, EllipseY1, EllipseX2, EllipseY2, StartX, StartY, EndX, EndY
Returns: Nothing
Use Pie to draw a filled Pie-shaped wedge on the canvas. The pie is part of an ellipse between the points EllipseX1, EllipseY1, EllipseX2, EllipseY2. The values StartX, StartY and EndX, EndY represent the starting and ending radial-points between which the Bounding-Arc is drawn.

element.name: TCanvas.PolyBezier
element.short: Polybezier draws cubic Bezier curves
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.PolyBezier
Params: Points, Filled, Continous
Returns: Boolean
Use Polybezier
to draw cubic Bezier curves.
The first curve is drawn from the first point to the fourth point with the second and third points being the control points.
If the Continuous flag is TRUE then each subsequent curve requires three more points, using the end-point of the previous Curve as its starting point, the first and second points being used as its control points, and the third point its end-point.
If the continous flag is set to FALSE, then each subsequent Curve requires 4 additional points, which are used exactly as in the first curve.
Any additonal points which do not add up to a full bezier(4 for Continuous, 3 otherwise) are ingored. There must be at least 4 points for an drawing to occur.
If the Filled Flag is set to TRUE then the resulting Poly-Bezier will be drawn as a Polygon.

element.name: TCanvas.Polygon
element.short: Polygon draws a closed, many-sided shape on the canvas, using the value of Pen
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Polygon
Params: Points: array of TPoint; Winding: Boolean = False; StartIndex: Integer = 0; NumPts: Integer = -1
Returns: Nothing
Use Polygon
to draw a closed, many-sided shape on the canvas, using the value of Pen
. After drawing the complete shape, Polygon
fills the shape using the value of Brush
.
The Points
parameter is an array of points that give the vertices of the polygon.
Winding
determines how the polygon is filled. When Winding
is True, Polygon
fills the shape using the Winding
fill algorithm.
When Winding
is False, Polygon
uses the even-odd (alternative) fill algorithm.
StartIndex
gives the index of the first point in the array to use. All points before this are ignored.
NumPts
indicates the number of points to use, starting at StartIndex
.
If NumPts
is -1 (the default), Polygon
uses all points from StartIndex
to the end of the array.
The first point is always connected to the last point.
To draw a polygon on the canvas, without filling it, use the Polyline
method, specifying the first point a second time at the end.

element.name: TCanvas.Polyline
element.short: Polyline connects a set of points on the canvas
element.descr:
Method: TCanvas.Polyline
Params: Points: array of TPoint; StartIndex: Integer = 0; NumPts: Integer = -1
Returns: Nothing
Use Polyline
to connect a set of points on the Canvas
. If you specify only two points, Polyline
draws a single line.
The Points
parameter is an array of points to be connected.
StartIndex
identifies the first point in the array to use.
NumPts
indicates the number of points to use. If NumPts
is -1 (the default), PolyLine
uses all the points from StartIndex
to the end of the array.
Calling the MoveTo
function with the value of the first point, and then repeatedly calling LineTo
with all subsequent points will draw the same image on the canvas. However, unlike LineTo
, Polyline
does not change the value of PenPos
.

element.name: TCanvas.TextOut
element.short: Writes the Text string at the position X, Y on the canvas and leaves the pen at the end of the text

element.name: TCanvas.TextRect
element.short: Writes Text string within a specified rectangle, according to predefined Style
element.descr:
Writes Text string within a specified rectangle, according to predefined Style
The boundaries of the rectangle are specified in ARect
X, Y specify the starting point for writing the Text within the rectangle
TextStyle determines whether the text is justified, centered, word-wrapped etc. If the Style argument is omitted, defaults are assumed

element.name: TBitmap
element.short: TBitmap is the data of an image, and can be loaded from a file, stream or resource in .bmp or .xpm format
element.descr:
TBitmap is the data of an image. The image can be loaded from a file, stream or resource in .bmp (windows bitmap format) or .xpm (XPixMap format)
The loading routine automatically recognizes the format, so it is also used to load the images from Delphi form streams (e.g. .dfm files).
When the handle is created, it is up to the interface (gtk, win32, ...) to convert it automatically to the best internal format. That is why the Handle is interface dependent.
To access the raw data, see TLazIntfImage in IntfGraphics.pas

element.name: TBitmap.Create
element.short: BitMap constructor
element.descr: BitMap constructor. The supplied code can override the definition from ancestor classes

element.name: TBitmap.Destroy
element.short: BitMap destructor
element.descr: BitMap destructor. The supplied code can override the method defined for ancestor classes

element.name: TBitmap.Assign
element.short: Assign: find out about the Source of the call.
element.descr: Assign: find out about the Source of the call. If the BitMap data are already in use, the data are shared; if not, a new BitMap is produced

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromDevice
element.short: LoadFromDevice: obtain BitMap data from a device with Handle DC

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromStream
element.short: LoadFromStream: obtains BitMap data from a Stream

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromLazarusResource
element.short: LoadFromLazarusResource: obtain data from a valid Lazarus Resource Stream
element.descr:
LoadFromLazarusResource: obtain data from a valid Lazarus Resource Stream
Checks for the presence of a valid Lazarus Resource, then uses LoadFromStream to acquire the data

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromXPMFile
element.short: LoadFromXPMFile: obtain data from file in native PixMap format

element.name: TPixmap
element.short: PixMap - a class derived from TBitMap , with wrapper to deal specifically with PixMaps (ie using 'XPM' format)
element.descr: PixMap - Checks that specified resources (PixMap image, File for storage, Stream for writing) are of correct type and format, organises saving and writing

element.name: TPixmap.LazarusResourceTypeValid
element.short: LazarusResourceTypeValid - checks that specified resource has correct format

element.name: TPixmap.LazarusResourceTypeValid.Result
element.short: Returns True if resource type is 'XPM'

element.name: TPixmap.WriteStream
element.short: WriteStream - writes PixMap data to specified stream

element.name: TPixmap.WriteStream.WriteSize
element.short: True if size of data in stream has been specified

element.name: TPixmap.GetDefaultFPReader
element.short: GetDefaultFPReader - obtains the correct tool

element.name: TPixmap.GetDefaultFPReader.Result
element.short: Returns the correct tool for reading

element.name: TPixmap.GetDefaultFPWriter
element.short: GetDefaultFPWriter - obtains the correct tool

element.name: TPixmap.GetDefaultFPWriter.Result
element.short: Returns the correct tool for writing

element.name: TIcon
element.short: TIcon - icons, small images typically associated with applications, controls, etc. Stored in files with .ico extension
element.descr:
TIcon reads and writes .ICO file format.
A .ico file typically contains several versions of the same image.
When loading, the largest/most colourful image is loaded as the TBitmap and so can be handled as any other bitmap. Any other versions of the images are available via the Bitmaps property
Writing is not (yet) implemented.

element.name: TIcon.Bitmaps
element.short: Bitmaps - the list of alternative bitmaps (of various sizes)

element.name: TIcon.Destroy
element.short: TIcon destructor
element.descr: TIcon destructor. Method can override the destructor defined in ancestor classes

element.name: TIcon.AddBitmap
element.short: Add a bitmap to the current list
element.descr: Note that Ownership passes to TIcon
